clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Utidelone Injection in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Colorectal Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Open, Multicenter, Monotherapy, Phase II Clinical Study of Utidelone Injection in Patients With Advanced or Metastatic Colorectal Cancer After Failure or Intolerability to Second-line Standard Treatment

brief_summary.textblock: To assess the effectiveness and safety of utidelone injection in patients with advanced or metastatic colorectal cancer (CRC) as a phase II trial

primary_outcome.description: Reflected by percentage of tumor size reduction or regression, assessed by imaging techniques and expressed as Objective Response Rate (ORR）ORR is defined as the proportion of patients with a best overall response of Complete Response (CR) or Partial Response (PR) according to RECIST. 1.1.

secondary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the duration of time from first study treatment to disease progression or death from any cause as documented by the investigator
OS is defined as the duration of time from first study treatment until death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.measure: Safety profile associated with utidelone injection
secondary_outcome.description: Observe and record adverse effects and severe adverse effects associated with utidelone injection

arm_group.description: Utidelone Injection: 40 mg/m2/day, IV transfusing over 90 min. on day 1-day 5 of each 21 day cycle, administered to enrolled patients with advanced or metastatic CRC

intervention.description: utidelone monotherapy in patients with advanced or metastatic CRC by iv transfusing utidelone injection

facility.name: The Sixth Affiliated Hospital of Sun Yat-sen University
